data.name: Azumarill δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Metal type.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Hatenna
data.flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

abilities.name: Leaf Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Grass Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Supernatural
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You may use the effect of a Supporter card you find there as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's hand.)

attacks.name: Dark Bind
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Sableye. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said that Charizard's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

data.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

data.name: Pyroar

abilities.name: Intimidating Mane
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Fang
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

data.name: Shiinotic

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

data.name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Foul Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.flavorText: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

data.name: Slaking

attacks.name: Pitch
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there's no food left within its reach.

attacks.name: Dark Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn. Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Spread Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Solar Power
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Your Active Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venusaur equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Venusaur has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

data.name: Spewpa

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

data.name: Leafeon

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Sand Impact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Dugtrio. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Manectric does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Sawsbuck

attacks.name: Nature Power
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to both your and your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

data.name: Darumaka
data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

data.name: Pokémon Park
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Once during each player's turn, when that player attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, he or she removes 1 damage counter from that Pokémon.

data.name: Salazzle

abilities.name: Hot Poison
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

data.name: Surskit

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Water Sport
attacks.text: If Piplup has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus more 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Wavelet
attacks.text: If you have Buizel in play, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives along shores in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes to hunt.

data.name: Dewpider

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

data.name: Totodile

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

abilities.name: Lazy Aura
abilities.text: As long as Slaking is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lazy Headbutt
attacks.text: Slaking is now Asleep.

data.name: Frosmoth

abilities.name: Ice Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

data.name: Seedot

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks if that damage is 40 or less.

data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

data.name: Manaphy

abilities.name: Aqua Skin
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Manaphy, remove 2 damage counters from Manaphy.

attacks.name: Chase Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fountain
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Lanturn has any Water Energy attached to it, Lanturn is both Water and Lightning type.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more then 40 damage in this way.

data.name: Sawsbuck

abilities.name: Seasonal Blessings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

attacks.name: Synchronized Search
attacks.text: If Girafarig and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, pick any 1 card from your deck and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Breaking Impact
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost to that Pokémon (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

data.name: Erika
rules: You may draw up to 3 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 3 cards.

data.name: Volcarona

attacks.name: Solar Birth
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

data.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Cradily from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for up to 3 in any combination of Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards. Show them to your opponent and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torchic.

data.name: Xerneas-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: X Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use X Blast during your next turn.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

data.name: Pheromosa

attacks.name: White Ray
attacks.text: If you have only 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

data.name: Monferno
data.flavorText: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

data.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Roast Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.

data.name: Foongus
data.flavorText: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.

data.name: Team Aqua's Muk

abilities.name: Sludge Festival
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon in play (except for Team Aqua Pokémon) is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It immobilizes its opponents by wrapping them in its huge, poisonous body. It'll smoosh you, too!

data.name: Lugia

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card, a Water Energy card, and a Lightning Energy card attached to Lugia in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea, because its powers are too strong.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu.

data.name: Dark Weezing

attacks.name: Mass Explosion
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the total number of Koffings, Weezings, and Dark Weezings in play (Apply Weakness and Resistance.). Then, this attack does 20 damage to each Koffing, Weezing, and Dark Weezing (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Stun Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Researchers have observed these Pokémon reproducing in industrial waste sites.

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Exeggutor.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an Exeggcute cluster.

attacks.name: Zzzap
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies (both yours and your opponent's). Don't apply Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Metallic Thunder
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Metal Energy attached to Raichu. If you do, this attack's base damage is 90 instead of 50.

abilities.name: Water Pressure
abilities.text: As long as Blastoise's remaining HP is 40 or less, Blastoise does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Primal Aura
abilities.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, neither player can play Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Auto Fire
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Invitation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Nidoqueen is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Basic Pokémon and each Evolution card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

data.name: Miracle Energy
rules:
You can't have more than 1 Miracle Energy in your deck. Attach Miracle Energy to 1 of your Shining or Light Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard Miracle Energy.
While in play, Miracle Energy counts as every type of Energy but provides only 2 Energy at a time.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Sharp Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

data.name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Memory
abilities.text: Whenever an Evolved Pokémon attacks (even if it's your opponent's), it can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. It still has to pay for that attack's Energy cost. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Aerodactyl. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: A vicious Pokémon from the distant past, it appears to have flown by spreading its wings and gliding.

abilities.name: Suction Cups
abilities.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, whenever the Defending Pokémon retreats, discard all Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon when it goes to the Bench.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Shaymin

attacks.name: Flippity Flap
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

data.name: Chesnaught BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Chesnaught BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Tough Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself. This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Slice
attacks.text: Raichu can't use Slice during your next turn.

attacks.name: Split Ball
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Raichu to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Burst Ball
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to any of your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Miracle Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose either Asleep, Burned, or Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Venusaur.

data.flavorText: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

data.name: Koga
rules: If an attack from a Pokémon with Koga in its name does damage to a Defending Pokémon this turn, that Pokémon is then Poisoned.

data.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

data.name: Starly

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

data.name: Dialga LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Dialga. Dialga LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Time Skip
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your turn ends. If both of them are tails, after your opponent draws a card at the beginning of his or her next turn, his or her turn ends. This power can't be used if Dialga is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metal Flash
attacks.text: During your next turn, Dialga can't use Metal Flash.

data.name: Lilligant

attacks.name: Boo-Hoo
attacks.text: If your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn, that Pokémon will be Asleep.

attacks.name: Leaf Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

data.name: Garchomp

abilities.name: Rainbow Scale
abilities.text: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to any of the types of Energy attached to Garchomp, Garchomp's attacks do 40 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Rainbow Scale Poké-Body can't be used if Garchomp has any Special Energy cards attached to it.

data.flavorText: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to Raichu. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Reflection
attacks.text: You may move any number of Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Kingdra

attacks.name: Aqua Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for as many Water Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and this attack does 10 damage for each Water Energy card you chose. Put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Pump
attacks.text: You may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

data.name: Nincada

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.

data.name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Controlled Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

attacks.name: Shining Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: First Ticket
rules: Before you flip a coin to decide who goes first in a game, you may play this card. Don't flip that coin, and you go first. If both players play First Ticket, flip the coin as normal. (You may play only 1 First Ticket before you flip that coin.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Basic Pokémon or Basic Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thick Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Foongus

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.

data.name: Leavanny

abilities.name: Blanket Weaver
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon take 40 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Blanket Weaver Ability at a time.

data.flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

data.name: Moltres-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Destructive Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Flame
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Forretress

attacks.name: Spike Spread
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: You may switch Forretress with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

data.name: Octillery

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

data.name: Morelull

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Band Attack
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Beedrill you have in play.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

abilities.name: Burning Aura
abilities.text: As long as Typhlosion is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Typhlosion.

data.name: Accelgor
data.flavorText: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.

abilities.name: Sol Shade
abilities.text: As long as you have Solrock in play, each player's Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Moon Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card (excluding Supporter cards), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leaches off the life force of any who follow it.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Wobbuffet.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wobbuffet is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Panpour

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Top Burner
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon. Then, discard a card from the top of your opponent's deck for each Energy you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said to be the legendary bird Pokémon of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flare of flames.

data.name: Pachirisu

abilities.name: Self-Generation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Pachirisu from your hand onto your Bench, you may attach up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your hand to Pachirisu.

attacks.name: Shocking Bolt
attacks.text: Put all Energy cards attached to Pachirisu in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.

data.name: Shiinotic

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

data.name: Lilligant

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.

data.name: Amoonguss

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

abilities.name: Magnetic Field
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have basic Energy cards in your discard pile, you may discard any 1 card from your hand. Then search for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't return the card you first discarded to your hand in this way. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magnetic Force
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon (including Magneton).

data.name: Dark Sandslash
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Dark Sandslash is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Dark Sandslash is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

data.name: Skiddo
data.flavorText: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Turtonator

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

data.name: Luxray

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon LV.X in play, each of Luxray's attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Luxray.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxray.

data.flavorText: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.

data.name: Torterra

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Grass Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

data.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Mewtwo and remove 6 damage counters from Mewtwo.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

abilities.name: Poison Resistance
abilities.text: Scizor can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Snatch
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with no damage counters on it and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Metal Energy attached to Scizor. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Croconaw

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

data.name: Araquanid

attacks.name: Bubble Net
attacks.text: Energy can't be attached to the Defending Pokémon from your opponent's hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

data.name: Magmortar

abilities.name: Incandescent Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Blaster
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.

data.name: Roseanne's Research
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Super Rod
rules: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch Farfetch'd with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it eats the plant stalk it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stalk.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

data.flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Parallel Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from 1 of your Pokémon the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dozing Scales
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

data.name: Hariyama

attacks.name: Backward Belt Throw
attacks.text: You may do 80 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Hariyama does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

data.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Heartfelt Song
attacks.text: Discard a Darkness Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Hattrem
data.flavorText: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

data.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales or this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

data.name: Axew

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

data.name: Metagross
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Metal type.

abilities.name: Metal Juncture
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Squared Attack
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Absol

attacks.name: Baleful Wind
attacks.text: Choose a card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. If you discarded a Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium card, choose 1 more card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If you played Absol from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 10.

data.flavorText: It senses disasters coming and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.

abilities.name: Volunteer
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 4 damage counters from Ninetales and discard Ninetales from Vulpix. If you do, search your deck for Ninetales or Ninetales ex and put it onto Vulpix (this counts as evolving Vulpix). Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Trick Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

data.name: Bruxish

attacks.name: Vivid Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Fang
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

data.name: Meganium

abilities.name: Herbal Scent
abilities.text: When you play Meganium from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from all Grass Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

abilities.name: Regi Form
abilities.text: If you have Regirock, Regice, and Registeel in play, the attack cost of Regigigas's attacks is Colorless less.

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Regigigas does 40 damage to itself.

data.name: Dark Ariados

attacks.name: Entangle
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon, then flip a coin. If heads, the new Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing.

data.flavorText: Wherever it goes, it spins a thread that always leads back to its web.

data.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.

data.flavorText: Years of genetic experiments resulted in the creation of this never-before-seen violent Pokémon.

data.name: Masquerain

attacks.name: Threatening Pattern
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Energy can't be attached from your opponent's hand to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

data.name: TV Reporter
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Then discard any 1 card from your hand.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to Pikachu. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Celebi

attacks.name: Psychic Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads. Remove a number of damage counters from Celebi equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Celebi has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: When Celebi disappears deep in a forest, it is said to leave behind an egg it brought from the future.

data.name: Qwilfish

abilities.name: Counterattack Quills
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

data.name: Turtwig

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Turtwig.

attacks.name: Parboil
attacks.text: If you have Chimchar in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker

abilities.name: Steely Spirit
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

data.name: Rowlet

attacks.name: Hide and Seek
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

data.name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Peck Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

attacks.name: Pollen Shield
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Ledian can't become affected by a Special Condition. (Any other effects of attacks, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, and Trainer cards still happen.)

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Poké-Bodies, each of Butterfree FB's attacks does 30 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Select Powder
attacks.text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Yveltal-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Evil Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Y Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Volbeat

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.

data.name: Seedot
data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

data.name: Tyranitar ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Critical Crush
attacks.text: Discard 2 Basic Energy cards attached to Tyranitar ex or this attack does nothing.

data.name: Palkia LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Palkia. Palkia LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Restructure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, you switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Palkia is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Reflect
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Palkia to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sabrina
rules: Take all Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name and attach them to another 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Deoxys and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 40.

data.name: Durant

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Scrape Down
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

abilities.name: Afterburner
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flare Destroy
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Typhlosion and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Omanyte
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Helix Fossil Omanyte
data.flavorText: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Marshtomp does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Step In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

data.name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

data.name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: Each player plays with his or her Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.

data.name: Entei-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Pineco

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

data.name: Ninjask

abilities.name: Cast-off Shell
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.

data.name: Volcarona

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Burning Scales
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Wind Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

data.name: Honchkrow

abilities.name: Dark Genes
abilities.text: As long as Honchkrow has the Energy necessary to use its attack, each of your Murkrow can use Honchkrow's attack as its own without the Energy necessary to use that attack.

attacks.name: Dark Wing Flaps
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Poison
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aqua Smash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Vivillon

attacks.name: Conversion Powder
attacks.text: Choose either Asleep or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Colorful Wind
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

data.name: Team Aqua's Seviper

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venom Tail
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Seviper's tail is a sharp blade. It can even poison you!

abilities.name: Energy Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 1 Energy card from your hand. Then draw up to 3 cards from your deck. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Max Energy Source
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Infernape

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Up
attacks.text: If you have fewer than 10 Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, this attack does nothing. Shuffle 10 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.flavorText: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

abilities.name: Spike Storm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Cacturne is your Active Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that already has any damage counters on it. This power can't be used if Cacturne is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Triple Needle

data.flavorText: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.

data.name: Blipbug

data.flavorText: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn't.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

data.name: Chimchar
data.flavorText: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

data.name: Virizion

attacks.name: Wrapped in Wind

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.

data.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

data.flavorText: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

data.name: Quagsire

abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This carefree Pokémon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

data.name: Raichu-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark Ball-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Shining Genesect

abilities.name: Energy Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Grass Energy from 1 of your other Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Blaster
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.

data.name: Skiddo

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

data.name: Wimpod

abilities.name: Wimp Out
abilities.text: During your first turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

data.name: Gogoat

abilities.name: Sap Sipper

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathetic sense lets them run as if one being.

data.name: Azumarill

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Azumarill during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Bubble Pump
attacks.text: If Azumarill has 3 or more Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If Azurill is anywhere under Azumarill, flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.

data.name: Monferno

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap

data.flavorText: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

data.name: Chandelure

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

attacks.name: Alolan Club

data.flavorText: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.

data.name: Lt. Surge
rules: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)

data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

attacks.name: Thunder Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lumineon is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has a maximum HP of 100 or more and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Lumineon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lumineon. Then, return all Water Energy attached to Lumineon to your hand.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Immunity
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks done to Machamp.

attacks.text: Before doing damage, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, ignore this effect.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Darkrai LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Darkrai. Darkrai LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Dark Shadow
abilities.text: Each basic Darkness Energy card attached to your Darkness Pokémon now has the effect "If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance)." You can't use more than 1 Dark Shadow Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Endless Darkness
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, the Defending Pokémon is still Asleep. If both of them are tails, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It can produce ultracold air. Its body is frozen.

data.name: Whimsicott

attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

data.name: Rocket's Sneak Attack
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each tails, discard the top card of your deck. Ignore this effect if your opponent has any Water Pokémon in play.

data.flavorText: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.

data.name: Tepig

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

abilities.name: Intimidating Ring
abilities.text: As long as Ursaring is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack or use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Epic Splash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Combusken's High Jump Kick attack's base damage is 70.

data.name: Rowlet

abilities.name: Sky Circus
abilities.text: If you played Bird Keeper from your hand during this turn, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Wind Shard
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.

data.name: Passimian

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

data.name: Feraligatr

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

data.name: Froakie

abilities.name: Frubbles
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
